metadata.Description: Solar power generation using concentrated sunlight

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
Solar power generation using concentrated sunlight
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
A concept that aims to ensure a fair and equitable transition to a sustainable energy system, taking into account social, economic, and environmental aspects.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.

relations.Description: Concentrated solar power implements the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Description: Concentrated solar power is included in the renewable energy portfolio to diversify the energy mix and reduce reliance on fossil fuels.

relations.Description: Concentrated solar power partners with electricity grid operators to ensure the integration and efficient distribution of solar power into the grid.

relations.Description: Concentrated solar power contributes to climate change mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and promoting sustainable energy practices.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

A parabolic trough is a type of concentrated solar power technology that uses curved mirrors to focus sunlight onto a receiver tube. The receiver tube contains a heat transfer fluid, which is heated by the concentrated sunlight and used to generate steam for electricity generation.
relations.Subject: parabolic trough

relations.Description: A power tower, also known as a central receiver system, is a type of concentrated solar power technology that uses an array of mirrors to focus sunlight onto a receiver located at the top of a tower. The receiver absorbs the concentrated sunlight and transfers the heat to a heat transfer fluid, which is used to generate steam for electricity generation.
relations.Subject: power tower

relations.Description: A dish/engine system is a type of concentrated solar power technology that uses a parabolic dish to concentrate sunlight onto a receiver located at the focal point of the dish. The receiver absorbs the concentrated sunlight and transfers the heat to a heat transfer fluid, which is used to generate steam for electricity generation.
relations.Subject: dish/engine system

relations.Description: Concentrated solar photovoltaics is a type of concentrated solar power technology that uses lenses or mirrors to concentrate sunlight onto a small area of high-efficiency photovoltaic cells. The concentrated sunlight increases the intensity of the sunlight reaching the cells, resulting in higher electricity generation.
relations.Subject: concentrated solar photovoltaics

relations.Description: Concentrated solar thermal is a type of concentrated solar power technology that uses mirrors to concentrate sunlight onto a receiver, which contains a heat transfer fluid. The concentrated sunlight heats the fluid, which is then used to generate steam for electricity generation or other thermal applications.
relations.Subject: concentrated solar thermal
